title: Biden’s Asian Economic Plan is No Substitute for a Real Trade Deal
sub_head: The U.S.’s new blueprint for economic engagement with Asia is aimed at competing with China. But the plan fails to leverage the U.S.’s biggest economic strengths.
body:
President Biden’s economic plan to counter China in the Indo-Pacific region will probably fall short.
The U.S. and a dozen countries on Monday launched a new trade initiative called the Indo-Pacific Economic Framework. The move is clearly aimed at countering China’s influence in the region. Apart from traditional American allies like Australia and Japan, the initial members also include India and many economies in Southeast Asia, including Indonesia and Vietnam.
